intro: Tetraglochidion gimi, commonly known as the Gimi tetraglochidion, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
